replies.msg: ä¿‚ä¾D on9ä»”çœ¼ä¸­ æ´›åŸºç¥–åˆ©äºä¸€å®šå‹éæ¯”åˆ© è€é¦¬ ç¾æ–¯ é˜¿æœ—

è½ä¸‹æ³°åˆ©æ—©å…©å€‹æœˆé»æ¨£è¬›æ—ä¼¯ æ…‹åº¦ä¿‚æœƒæ„ŸæŸ“åŸ‹å…¶ä»–çƒå“¡

https://twitter.com/chelsea_fl/status/1049672342631256064

I have to say Frank was the key to our success over many years and when he first came as an experienced player at the time, captain of the time, you'd come in from training and Frank would be out there doing doggies, a bag of balls on his shoulder, get a goalkeeper practising for 40, 50, 60 minutes every single day and as a player what that did was that made you go ‘hold up I should be doing that’, all of a sudden Didier was out there with Lamps, I was out there with Lamps and the whole squad was out there and he just kind of pushed everyone to a different dimension and that comes from within as a boy to succeed and be the very best and for me, personally, I believe he’s the best player we’ve ever had at Chelsea at our football club.

Without a shadow of a doubt and I believe one of the best in world football, I mean at one stage he came second to Ronaldinho, who was probably one of the best ever and Frank just got pipped by him in World Footballer of the Year. I have to say it was an absolute pleasure to play and work and get an insight into what it takes to be the very best and I know a lot of young players nowadays would be looking at the Messis and the Ronaldos and those kind of boys to be the best and the role models but any young player striving to make it to the very top look no further than Frank Lampard.
